headline.seo: Do You Suffer From Decision Fatigue?
headline.main: Do You Suffer From Decision Fatigue?

docs.abstract: Researchers have found that the very act of making decisions depletes the ability to make decisions well, which they have dubbed 'decision fatigue'; research has shown that there are ways to mitigate decision fatigue, but these methods are of limited use in a society that offers endless choice.
docs.lead_paragraph: The very act of making decisions depletes our ability to make them well. So how do we navigate a world of endless choice?
docs.snippet: The very act of making decisions depletes our ability to make them well. So how do we navigate a world of endless choice?

headline.seo: Ban on Using Food Stamps to Buy Soda Rejected by U.S.D.A.
headline.print_headline: U.S. Rejects Mayor’s Plan to Ban Use of Food Stamps to Buy Soda
headline.main: U.S. Rejects Mayor’s Plan to Ban Use of Food Stamps to Buy Soda

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal ruling derailed one of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s big ideas to fight obesity and poor nutrition.
docs.snippet: The federal ruling derailed one of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s big ideas to fight obesity and poor nutrition.

docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (HBO) UNSTOPPABLE (2010) Denzel Washington, in his fifth collaboration with the director Tony Scott, plays Frank Barnes, a veteran engineer trying to stop a runaway train speeding through Pennsylvania with a load of hazardous cargo. Chris Pine, above right with Mr. Washington, is Will Colson, the new, hotheaded conductor Frank is charged with training. Writing in The New York Times, Manohla Dargis said that Mr. Scott, working with the cinematographer Ben Seresin and some ace sound technicians, ''creates an unexpectedly rich world of chugging, rushing trains slicing across equally beautiful industrial and natural landscapes,'' adding, ''There is something mesmerizing about these trains and the men who run them, something nostalgic too, because they seem like history machines, summoning up a past lived and also imagined, as in, for starters, 'The Great Train Robbery' (1903), 'North by Northwest' (1959) and 'Speed' (1994).' '' Alas, she said, '' 'Unstoppable' doesn't belong in that company: its story is largely forgettable, and its pleasures are transitory, limited to the actors (including Rosario Dawson and Kevin Corrigan, working up a sweat back in dispatch) and to its moments of beauty and strange comedy.'' Still, despite some ridiculous action flourishes from Mr. Scott, ''with a handful of appealing actors in tow, he sure keeps that machine going.'' NOON (13) RICHARD HEFFNER'S OPEN MIND Richard W. Johnson, the director of the Urban Institute's Program on Retirement Policy, discusses Americans' retirement preparedness and the benefits of working later in life.
docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (HBO) UNSTOPPABLE (2010) Denzel Washington, in his fifth collaboration with the director Tony Scott, plays Frank Barnes, a veteran engineer trying to stop a runaway train speeding through Pennsylvania with a load of hazardous cargo. Chris...

headline.main: Federal Officials Reject City's Plan to Ban Food Stamps for Soda

docs.abstract: Federal officials rejected a proposal to bar New York City’s food stamp users from buying soda with their benefits.
docs.snippet: Federal officials rejected a proposal to bar New York City’s food stamp users from buying soda with their benefits.

headline.main: Federal Officials Reject City's Plan to Ban Food Stamps for Soda

docs.abstract: The city proposed an experiment to see if barring the use of food stamps to buy sweetened drinks would reduce obesity in poor communities. The Agriculture Department on Friday said no.
docs.lead_paragraph: A version of this story with additional details can be found here
docs.snippet: The city proposed an experiment to see if barring the use of food stamps to buy sweetened drinks would reduce obesity in poor communities. The Agriculture Department on Friday said no.

docs.snippet: The fifth installment in our series on teenage health: teaching resources on nutrition and healthy eating habits.

headline.main: Adolescent Health | Nutrition, Healthy Weight and Eating Disorders

byline.original: By JENNIFER CUTRARO and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

docs.abstract: The fifth installment in our series on teenage health: teaching resources on nutrition and healthy eating habits.
docs.lead_paragraph: To wrap up Adolescent Health Week, here is our collection of materials on nutrition, healthy weight and eating disorders, including coverage of Michelle Obama's antichildhood obesity initiative and growing criticism of many school lunch programs.
docs.snippet: The fifth installment in our series on teenage health: teaching resources on nutrition and healthy eating habits.

headline.seo: Resveratrol-Mimicking Drug Found to Extend Lives of Obese Mice
headline.print_headline: Longer Lives for Obese Mice, With Hope for Humans of All Sizes
headline.main: Longer Lives for Obese Mice, With Hope for Humans of All Sizes

docs.lead_paragraph: The drug, which mimics resveratrol, protected the mice from the usual diseases of obesity and helped them live 44 percent longer than other obese mice, researchers said.
docs.snippet: The drug, which mimics resveratrol, protected the mice from the usual diseases of obesity and helped them live 44 percent longer than other obese mice, researchers said.

headline.print_headline: Patterns: Mothers’ Weight Tied to Youths’ Asthma
headline.main: Asthma More Likely Among Children of Overweight Mothers

docs.abstract: Teenagers whose mothers had been overweight or obese just before they became pregnant were 20 to 30 percent more likely to have asthma or a history of wheezing.
docs.snippet: Teenagers whose mothers had been overweight or obese just before they became pregnant were 20 to 30 percent more likely to have asthma or a history of wheezing.
